name: elsigagen
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(csigagen, c0)))

stmt.origin: sselda(c2, c0, cfv(csigagen, c0), wcel(c0, c1))

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(csigagen, c0)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, cfv(csigagen, c0)))
body.pretty:
⊢ ((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ c2 ∈ c0)→ c2 ∈(sigaGen ` c0))
⊣ (c0 ∈ c1 → c0 ⊆(sigaGen ` c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(csigagen, c0)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, cfv(csigagen, c0)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ ((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ c2 ∈ c0)→ c2 ∈(sigaGen ` c0))
⊣ (c0 ∈ c1 → c0 ⊆(sigaGen ` c0))

cumulated.origin: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(csigagen, c0)))

comment: Any element of a set is also an element of the sigma-algebra that set generates. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 27-Mar-2017.)
